column5: Really nice to see a Paper hire a New Outdoor Columnist maybe this will be the start of something Tight Lines SBK Building A Steelhead Destination
WTG Josh, great article. You do the Choronzey name proud!
Yes indeed Josh, well done. It sure is nice to see these types of columns back in the papers again.
great first article!  volunteers don't seek it, but never get the credit they deserve.

It was a great read.  Nice to know people out there appreciate guys like Josh. This is a great way to get people aware of various projects that people could get involved in. I'll bet Josh has some great experiences fishing that he could write articles about.  Looking forward to reading other articles from the gentleman.   Cheers, Ron...
Good stuff Josh! Congrats. Great to see

Congrates Josh....nice shout out for Grant Ferris....to this day i feel proud to have had the honour of shaking his hand on a couple of occasions as well as working along the side of Gary Biederman... Both amongst others are truely a driving force to our fishery and its future  For all the people that appreciate the Lake Huron Rivers...you should all come up and appreciate the lake during the derby.... i garantee you will make friends to last a lifetime   http://64.177.125.54/Chantry/index.htm   Did i mention ....you can EAT the fish!!!  Cheers
"Campfire Comment".Whether you like or dislike the old man,he sure makes some valid comments imo.

Leave the old man out of it.  This is a good article by the son.  I happen to like the old man. Whether you do or do not like the old man has nothing to do with the work of the son.  He is his own person and should be judged on his own merits.
If I lived in that area and was a reader of that paper, I would be thrilled that it added an outdoors piece.  I wish my local paper would do the same.
Grimace,I was referring to the campfire comment,:oops:his sons work is good.I also like the old man.

I realize that you were just responding.   I was just thinking that if the son would read this thread and saw it turn into a Darryl Choronzey thread instead of what it should be, well, it would be slightly depressing that's all.  Anyways, I thought it was a nice article giving credit to the people behind the scenes.

I Just sent an E-mail to Lucknow & Kincardine Papers it looks like their all owned by the same company, Maybe putting a bug in their Ear will get it republished in some of the Local weeklies, especially if the Articles are about the Area it can`t hurt, lets all send out some support & maybe get them thinking about it, this is the Companies list of papers check it out & send an E-mail Thanx & Tight Lines Spinnerbaitking
IF I HAD THE CHANCE TO FISH WITH ANYONE I WANTED...IT WOULD BE DARRYL, HOPE HIS SON IS A CHIP OFF THE OLD BLOCK
